definition: to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: Paul, denied of every comfort, wrote the above words in his dungeon.
sentences.chinese: 保羅，輕看了一切的福樂，在監獄中寫上面的幾句話。

definition: full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
